name: tert-butyl acrylate
Reason: 1,3-Butadiene has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The introduction of a tert-butyl group (–CH2–CH2–CH2–) increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point. Additionally, the acrylate group (–CO–CH2–CH2–) introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point. The tert-butyl group also enhances the molecular rigidity due to its bulky size. The net effect should be a significant increase in melting point due to the combination of molecular size, hydrogen bonding, and rigidity.
